intro: Phormium hyacinthoides, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a striking plant native to New Zealand. It is a perennial plant belonging to the Asphodelaceae family, characterized by its sword-shaped, fibrous leaves that can grow up to 2 meters in length. The plant produces tall, erect flowering stems with showy, spathaceous inflorescences that range in color from yellow to red. Its fibrous leaves have historically been used by Māori for making clothing, ropes, and other crafts. The plant thrives in full sun to partial shade and is well-suited for coastal and temperate climates.
